forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear. Low around 46, with temperatures rising to around 48 overnight. Northwest wind 6 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The afternoon unfurls across Downtown San Francisco, offering a mix of subdued warmth and gentle breezes. The sky is adorned with patches of azure, where the sun’s effort to break free is promising yet playful. Although the forecast hints at a whisper of rain before the hour strikes four, it appears the city is preparing for an embrace of mostly sunny skies, where the high will reach the mid-fifties. There’s a chill in the air, accompanied by a westward wind, inviting layers to keep your essence warm against the fleeting chill of winter.

As the evening takes its turn, expect a transition to clearer skies, with temperatures settling into the comfortable embrace of the mid-forties, offering a serene respite as night unfurls. The absence of fog is a welcome sign; rather, a gentle clarity prevails, ideal for a stroll along the Embarcadero or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the city’s hidden parks. With layered clothing to combat the cool breeze, one might consider an afternoon art exhibition or a leisurely coffee at a cozy café—inviting warmth against the evening cool as the sun slips into the horizon, trailing whispers of gold and lavender.
